channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The week the pandemic came to Trump
Cuomo warns of 'different chapter' as 5-year-old dies from COVID-related complications
item.description: For months, parents have been counting their blessings amid reports that the novel coronavirus generally seemed to spare children.

item.title: Canada records its second-highest ever unemployment rate
'Covid toes' may be sign you previously had coronavirus
item.description: Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers viewers questions at CNN's coronavirus town hall.

item.title: Why does Bollywood use the offensive practice of brownface in movies?
item.description: Bollywood may be best known for its glamorous casts, glitzy costumes and energetic dance routines. But it also has a far less flattering reputation -- for promoting the offensive practice of brownface.

item.title: 'The real situation must be worse': The disturbing gap in China's unemployment numbers
item.description: Wang is used to job hunting in China.

item.title: It's what I can't see in the Ahmaud Arbery shooting video that also terrifies me
Biden accuser Tara Reade says he should drop out of 2020 presidential race
item.description: Tara Reade, a former Senate aide who has accused Joe Biden of sexually assaulting her in 1993, said in a new interview that the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee should withdraw from the 2020 race.

item.title: Bolsonaro continues to dismiss Covid-19 threat as cases and deaths skyrocket
item.description: Brazil's coronavirus cases have spiked to 135,106 including 9,146 deaths, according to numbers released Wednesday by the Brazilian Health Ministry. This surge comes as President Jair Bolsonaro's spokesman, Gen. Otavio Santana do Rego Barros, confirmed he tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: The two countries that show life beyond lockdown isn't what people think it will be
item.description: Life as we know it in much of the world has been turned upside down by the coronavirus. But two countries have been widely held up as examples of how to handle a pandemic: South Korea and Germany.

item.title: Rats are infecting humans with hepatitis, and nobody knows how
item.description: In 2018, infectious disease experts at the University of Hong Kong came across an unusual patient.

item.title: 'Never give up, never despair': Queen likens UK public's response to WWII soldiers
item.description: Queen Elizabeth II has likened the British public's response to the coronavirus pandemic with the efforts of its soldiers during World War II, in a televised speech delivered exactly 75 years after her father marked the end of fighting in Europe.

item.title: Queen Elizabeth reveals 'one of most memorable nights' in rare interview
item.description: Queen Elizabeth speaks about her experience as a 19-year-old princess celebrating VE day when Nazi troops surrendered to Allied troops ending World War II.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Meet OAN, the little-watched right-wing news channel that Trump keeps promoting
item.description: On one afternoon in April, Yamiche Alcindor, the White House correspondent for PBS Newshour, grew exasperated.

item.title: Once the coronavirus 'epicenter,' this American city reversed course
item.description: "Chaos" was how Dr. Kevin Hanson described his emergency department at EvergreenHealth hospital in suburban Seattle.

item.title: Mail carrier becomes an instant star after interrupting this TikTok recording
item.description: Annette Desmond, a mail carrier for the US Postal Service, became a TikTok sensation after pulling up her truck right as neighbors Alexa Dinga and Collins Kitchens were about to record one of their TikTok dances.

item.title: Trump just called the Russia investigation a 'hoax' ... while on the phone with Putin
item.description: On Thursday, President Donald Trump called the federal investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election a "hoax." While on the phone with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: People died on the spot after gas leak at chemical plant in India
item.description: At least 11 people have been confirmed dead and hundreds more have been hospitalized after a suffocating toxic gas rose from a chemical plant in southern India.

item.title: Some of Hollywood's biggest actors performed together on Zoom
item.description: Some of Hollywood's most respected actors performed "Oedipus Rex" for a global audience of thousands Thursday night -- on Zoom.

item.title: This is what it's like to be a funeral worker during a pandemic
item.description: Funeral workers, who have been busy coping with Covid-19's growing death toll in the UK, are the forgotten frontline workers in the pandemic. CNN's Phil Black reports on the unique challenges they're facing.

item.title: The EU admits it let China censor a coronavirus op-ed its ambassadors wrote
item.description: The European Union has acknowledged it allowed the Chinese government to censor an opinion piece published in the country, removing a reference to the origin of the coronavirus outbreak and its subsequent spread worldwide.

item.title: Ted Cruz gets hair cut at salon whose owner was arrested for reopening early
item.description: Republican Sen. Ted Cruz of Texas got his hair cut Friday at a Texas salon whose owner was jailed this week for defying her state's stay-at-home order and reopening her business early.

item.title: Germany bans gay conversion therapy for minors
item.description: Germany has become the latest country to ban gay conversion therapy for those below the age of 18.

item.title: Toilet flush doesn't stop lawyer's Supreme Court argument
item.description: The sound of a toilet flush was heard during the Supreme Court's live broadcast of oral arguments around a law meant to prohibit robocalls.

item.title: Coronavirus found in men's semen
item.description: The new coronavirus can persist in men's semen even after they have begun to recover, a finding that raises the possibility the virus could be sexually transmitted, Chinese researchers said Thursday.

item.title: Elon Musk and Grimes reveal how to pronounce baby's name -- but they disagree
item.description: Elon Musk and Grimes have garnered plenty of attention since announcing the name of their newborn baby, but now it seems they can't agree on how it should be pronounced.

item.title: Suspect in serial killings arrested in 29-year-old cold case
item.description: A former truck driver has been arrested in a Tennessee murder case from 1991 and in two similar cases in Wyoming the following year, officials said.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic could contribute to surge of other deadly diseases
item.description: Cases of malaria, HIV/AIDS and other diseases could surge worldwide in coming months as global health systems rally to battle the coronavirus pandemic, global health experts tell CNN.

item.title: Why Al Gore says US is in 'grave danger'
item.description: Former Vice President Al Gore explains what he thinks it means to be a leader during times of crisis, and why he believes President Donald Trump has failed during this pandemic.

item.title: Frosted Flakes for dinner. Hiding in the laundry room. This is life for single moms right now.
Last Nazi message decoded by Britain revealed to mark VE Day
item.description: The last recorded Nazi message intercepted and decoded by Britain in World War II has been revealed for the first time to mark the 75th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day.

item.title: Seattle to permanently close 20 miles of streets to traffic for exercise and biking
item.description: Seattle residents will have more space to exercise and bike on as the city plans to permanently close 20 miles of streets to most vehicular traffic, the mayor announced Thursday.

item.title: The people waiting out Covid-19 in dark, frozen Antarctica
item.description: While the rest of the world continues to grapple with the coronavirus pandemic, one continent has managed to remain entirely free of the infection.

item.title: A pair of game-worn, autographed Air Jordan 1s head to auction
item.description: Michael Jordan fans, ready your wallets.

item.title: What this image says about the coronavirus pandemic
Will the world still want multimillion-dollar supercars? Bugatti's about to find out
item.description: In late March, when the coronavirus pandemic spurred Bugatti to shut down production at its factory in eastern France, workers had just begun building the company's new $6 million Divo supercar. When the factory reopened six weeks later, it was to a new world -- one in which the global economy had been devastated.

item.title: These 'high risk' sex offenders were released early. A prosecutor warns they're still a threat
item.description: They were accused of crimes ranging from molesting children to public lewdness. Under California state law, all were supposed to serve at least six months in jail for violating terms of their parole by evading electronic law enforcement monitoring.

item.title: Over 19,000 artifacts seized in global anti-trafficking operation
item.description: A worldwide anti-trafficking operation has recovered more than 19,000 stolen artifacts, including rare coins, fossils, artworks and antiques.

item.title: Malia Obama makes rare appearance in documentary
item.description: Former first daughter Malia Obama makes a rare appearance on Michelle Obama's Netflix documentary, where she gets emotional after seeing the crowd for her mom's book tour.

item.title: Brian May hospitalized after injuring buttocks
item.description: Queen guitarist Brian May has revealed he ended up in hospital after injuring his buttocks during an incident in his garden.

item.title: These CrossFit workout routines will allow you to train like the fittest athletes on Earth
item.description: Stuck at home and struggling for motivation to get fit during the coronavirus pandemic? We may be able to help you.

item.title: Ariana Grande uses 'Stuck With U' with Justin Bieber to reveal new boyfriend
item.description: Leave it to Ariana Grande and Justin Bieber to give us a quarantine love song.

item.title: A new way to travel to Paris
The US President hoped he would find a nation in recovery. Instead, the coronavirus entered his inner circle
item.description: President Donald Trump hoped this would be the week he emerged into a nation recovering from pandemic. Instead the pandemic came to him.

item.title: Trump gave an astonishing call-in interview to 'Fox & Friends'
item.description: • Trump promotes a channel with far-right agitators. And it's not Fox

item.title: Canada records second-highest ever unemployment rate
It's what I can't see in the Ahmaud Arbery shooting video that also terrifies me
item.description: • Men accused of killing Arbery thought he was burglary suspect. No burglaries were reported in month prior.

item.title: Trump's path of selfish expediency
item.description: It was always going to come to this.
